{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3705383,"name":"PhilBot","username":"PhilBot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/philbot/{size}/1824_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-07T15:40:20.195Z","cooked":"

We used PathPlanner and Swerve/AprilTag odometry extensively this year.

Now we are preparing to compete at RoboConNJ, and due to the venue space restrictions they are using a truncated field. See Here https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kFwvDKuxn31qkkcHneqTlezHYqUbKK4o/view

So I’ll at least need to create a new JSON file with the adjusted AprilTag locations, but I don’t know what to do with all our PathPlanner paths.

To adjust our existing paths I can probably load a new field image but I’m most concerned about 1) setting the 0:0 origin, and then 2) having the path ocoordinates flip correctly from Blue to Red. It seems like I’d need to set a new mirror line.

Does anyone know if this is something that is already configurable, or where I’d start looking to make the changes myself.

Thanks.

At least for flipping stuff, the field-size seems to be a constant, which is definitely an issue: here.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-08-07T15:44:32.480Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":71.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505069,"topic_slug":"how-to-adapt-pathplanner-to-off-season-field-dimensions","display_username":"Nolan Barker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/mjansen4857/pathplanner/blob/main/pathplannerlib/src/main/java/com/pathplanner/lib/util/FlippingUtil.java#L13-L16","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"pathplanner/pathplannerlib/src/main/java/com/pathplanner/lib/util/FlippingUtil.java at main · mjansen4857/pathplanner · GitHub","clicks":17}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65568,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming Lead, Co-captain | 3414 Hackbots"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-adapt-pathplanner-to-off-season-field-dimensions/505069/2","custom_user_title":"Programming Lead, Co-captain | 3414 Hackbots","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3705391,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-07T15:53:06.593Z","cooked":"
PhilBot:

So I’ll at least need to create a new JSON file with the adjusted AprilTag locations, but I don’t know what to do with all our PathPlanner paths.

I wont hold them to it but a volunteer I know said he would be willing to do this specifically for robocon and share it with all teams. I will send this to him to see if he still has time. Whoever ends up doing this it would be great if it was shared publicly.

As for flipping, you may have to take the flipped paths as they come from path planner then shift them over by however many meters the middle of the field moved. You can take the path, iterate over each of its points, and generate a new path with all the same headings but shifted over some offset? Would be a little bit of code but should work?

With the number of teams who might end up doing this at the event, id be happy to look into writing a function which can do this.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-08-07T15:53:06.593Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":221,"readers_count":220,"score":59.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505069,"topic_slug":"how-to-adapt-pathplanner-to-off-season-field-dimensions","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-adapt-pathplanner-to-off-season-field-dimensions/505069/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3705393,"name":"PhilBot","username":"PhilBot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/philbot/{size}/1824_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-07T16:02:27.323Z","cooked":"

That would be pretty amazing. The task seems complicated by the fact that 4 different chunks are being taken out of the field. I guess if the shrunk Blue side was pushed all the way over to the x=0 driver station, then the field would esentially have a hole in the middle that the “shift” math would take care of. Luckilly there probably aren’t too many Auto paths that actually span both sides of the field. I think the Red shift approach would totally break a spanning path.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-08-07T16:02:27.323Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":38.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505069,"topic_slug":"how-to-adapt-pathplanner-to-off-season-field-dimensions","display_username":"PhilBot","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":23320,"username":"Owen_Busler","name":"Owen Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":5633,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-adapt-pathplanner-to-off-season-field-dimensions/505069/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3705395,"name":"Paul Rensing","username":"prensing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prensing/{size}/65820_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-07T16:06:17.398Z","cooked":"

No guarantees, and I am not a PP developer but:

The field length and width are defined in pathplanner/lib/util/FlippingUtil.java, as fieldSizeX and fieldSizeY. These are actually marked as “public static” and thankfully not “final”.

So, you should be able to set those values really early in the code startup and the flipping will work. The path code does use that util to flip the trajectories.

But “trust but verify”.

Here is the progress I made tonight. This is a link to all my work on GH.

I was able to shift the april tag map and update the json (please check my work here, id hate to mess up a teams auto)

The path planner and advantage scope image can be found here. You can also add the field as a custom layout in advantage scope.

prensing:

So, you should be able to set those values really early in the code startup and the flipping will work.

This worked exactly as you expected! Thank you!

Here is a screenshot of advantage scope with a mirrored path looking pretty good and all 22 tags. The slight error in the mirroring is probably due to me cropping the field image by eyeball? Unsure. If you have any questions please LMK!

image1208×621 119 KB

Wow. Thanks for that.

Yeah, the advice here was great.
The code tweak works and I also discovered how to apply that new field image…

Looks like We’ll be ready for RoboCon

Phil.

Sorry for the repeat, I replied to me by mistake…

So, one last thing….

We display Auto paths and robot position on our dashboard.
Currently we are using either Smart Dashboard or Elastic.

I can’t figure out how to get either of these to accept a custom field image for Robocon NJ.

All the docs imply that you can switch the field image on Glass, but we’re not in a position to do that migration.

Any suggestions for working with Smart Dashboard or Elastic?

PhilBot:

aths and robot position on our dashboard.
Currently we are using either Smart Dashboard or Ela

Okay I had a second. It looks like at this path

“C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2025\elastic\data\flutter_assets\assets\fields”

You have a png and a JSON for each field. Its a bit of a hack but if you replace the 2024 field image with the robo con one and fix the JSON to match i dont see why that wouldnt work.

I can figure out what that JSON needs to be later.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-09-18T17:58:00.601Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":18.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505069,"topic_slug":"how-to-adapt-pathplanner-to-off-season-field-dimensions","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-adapt-pathplanner-to-off-season-field-dimensions/505069/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3742125,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-18T18:25:29.916Z","cooked":"

Threw this together with not too much testing. I could not get elastic to add another field, so this one replaces the 2024 field. In elastic you will select “Crescendo” and the robocon field will show up. If you copy and replace the 2024 png and json at

“C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2025\elastic\data\flutter_assets\assets\fields”

with these files it should work

github.com

frc2025_roboconPathplanning/elasticAssets at main ·...

Contribute to owen1050/frc2025_roboconPathplanning development by creating an account on GitHub.

Edit: did a little testing and its… okay? The tags are close to the field overlay but not as perfect as path planner or advantage scope. You could try messing with the field json if thats not good enough.

So, I finally got a chance to deploy all my “simulator” tested code to the robot and it had issues…..

Finally nailed it down to the apriltag json file path.

String path = Filesystem.getDeployDirectory().getAbsolutePath() + “\2025-reefscape-welded-robocon.json”;

Turns out that the robot doesn’t like the backslash in the name. Much prefers regular forward slash. So needed to switch it to:

String path = Filesystem.getDeployDirectory().getAbsolutePath() + “/2025-reefscape-welded-robocon.json”;
